storyData.story: As a parent, it can be hard to balance childcare with the demands of work – especially when many jobs involve fixed hours and lengthy commutes. However, there is a solution! Freelance proofreading and editing can be a great, flexible career choice for moms and dads who want to earn an income without sacrificing too much time with their family.

If you’re approaching retirement but aren’t ready to give up work entirely, freelance proofreading and editing could be the answer! You can earn extra income and keep your mind sharp – without sacrificing the freedom and flexibility that come with retirement.

For many people – such as parents, primary caregivers, and those with disabilities or chronic health conditions – remote and work from home opportunities are essential. They allow individuals to earn an income while avoiding some of the constraints of a traditional in-office role and commute.

As a parent, it can be hard to balance childcare with the demands of work – especially when many jobs involve fixed hours and lengthy commutes. However, there is a solution! Freelance proofreading and editing can be a great, flexible career choice for moms and dads who want to earn an income without sacrificing too much time with their family.

Do you love reading, writing, or language? Perhaps you’ve already considered a career as a proofreader or editor, but weren’t sure how to make it happen? Well, we’ve got good news – it’s never too late to make a career change or turn a hobby or interest into a rewarding career!

There are lots of factors that contribute to job satisfaction: having varied, interesting work, having opportunities for career development, being able to maintain a good work–life balance, and feeling valued for your contributions (to name just a few).

Since completing our Becoming A Proofreader course, Mark has been able to do exactly that. As a freelance proofreader, he has the flexibility to earn an income on his own terms. This lets him focus on caring for his elderly parents while still having time to enjoy his many hobbies.

Lauren was looking for a job she could do from home that would fit around homeschooling her daughter. She completed our Becoming A Proofreader course and now works for Proofed on the weekends. This has allowed her to take control of her career – she can decide when, where, and how to work, and she has more time to spend with her daughter.

Since completing our Becoming A Proofreader course, Naomi has transitioned to full-time proofreading. She works with Proofed in addition to managing her own clients she’s found online, and she structures her day around various goals and projects. She enjoys the variety that each new day brings and is very happy to be free from long, rush hour commutes!
